place.name: BRACEBOROUGH
place.gazetteerText: BRACEBOROUGH, a parish in Stamford district, Lincoln; on the river Glen, and on the Bourne and Essendine railway, 3 miles NE of Essendine, and 3¼ SW of Bourne. It includes Shillingthorpe hamlet; and has a station, of the name of Braceborough Spa, on the railway; and its Post Town is Thurlby, under Bourne. Acres, 2,230. Real property, £2,628. Pop., 220. Houses, 35. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £160.* Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is good. There is a private lunatic asylum. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
